column1: North Royalton is a city in Cuyahoga County

The North Royalton School District serves approximately 4700 students in the communities of North Royalton and Broadview Hts.

Royal Redeemer Lutheran School (K-8) The city of North Royalton is also in the process of building a new elementary school across from the apple farm on State Road. Clearing of trees began in April 2019

North Royalton's public library is a branch of the Cuyahoga County Public Library (CCPL)
column2: the busiest per-capita system in the country. A new building to which all functions have been transferred opened in August 2013
column3: is located two miles north of the city center at 5071 Wallings Road
column5: Ohio and under the direction of Viceroy Tyler Frantz. It was formerly located at 14600 State Road (OH-94) with North Royalton's Memorial Park almost adjacent to Route 82. Its website is part of the CCPL's website. The existing library structure was then converted into a new city hall facility
column6: which opened to the public in 2015.
